title: Brain has natural weapon to fight Alzheimer's, UTMB scientists find
description: People with Alzheimer's disease who don't also have dementia are protected by a natural physiological process that removes toxic proteins from living cells. Dr. Giulio Taglialatela is quoted.
cleaned_text: UTMB scientists find](https://nam11.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.galvnews.com%2Fnews%2Fbrain-has-natural-weapon-to-fight-alzheimers-utmb-scientists-find%2Farticle_aa83e0d3-ba19-58f5-a353-ee1b87bbcafd.html&data=05%7C01%7Cvlwells%40UTMB.EDU%7C68517b79147e47546cba08db5e0b8d3a%7C7bef256d85db4526a72d31aea2546852%7C0%7C0%7C638207176002854375%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C3000%7C%7C%7C&sdata=wC0v20IYbFiF2KhpRWLO%2F%2FJZq8TmqlIadizpiLUjmYQ%3D&reserved=0) Galveston County Daily News, May 24, 2023 People with Alzheimer's disease who don't also have dementia are protected by autophagy, a natural physiological process that removes toxic proteins from living cells, according to new UTMB research. "Those fortunate individuals are telling us there is a natural way for the human brain to protect itself against dementia," UTMB's Dr. Giulio Taglialatela told the Daily News.
